comments.author: hosemary
comments.body: That's not the only account used for this scam.The scammer has used at least 8 other accounts for posting link to that malware. Txau (click here to see the post on loyce.club.)Hypocalese (click here.) nemruth (click here.)Atrain622 (click here.)LauMarthel (click here.)fearofsalt (click here.)lhfly5201314 (click here.)swami84 (click here.)

comments.author: JeromeTash
comments.body: Looks like a hacked account, though. It was used to post malware in 2020 too - https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5182222.msg55090568#msg55090568Good move to have it banned for nowAnybody who has a GitHub account can report this profile (https://github.com/BitcointalkWallet-project). It was created 2 days ago. I have reported it.

comments.author: DaveF
comments.body: I guess the question is why have all the other accounts that have posted the malware not been banned? Usually they get banned / nuked when they are posting things like that but users on the list that hosseinimr93 posted are all still here?Or is it more the altcoin sections that bans for malware wallets are quick.Reported to github. Looks like this is the new whack a mole.-Dave

comments.author: hosemary
comments.body: Quote from: DaveF on February 04, 2023, 10:14:52 PMUsually they get banned / nuked when they are posting things like that but users on the list that hosseinimr93 posted are all still here?I just checked their profile on BPIP. 5 out of the 8 accounts I mentioned above have been banned. nemruth, Atrain622 and lhfly5201314 haven't been banned and should be still able to make post in the forum.

comments.author: mole0815
comments.body: Quote from: hosseinimr93 on February 04, 2023, 10:28:50 PMQuote from: DaveF on February 04, 2023, 10:14:52 PMUsually they get banned / nuked when they are posting things like that but users on the list that hosseinimr93 posted are all still here?I just checked their profile on BPIP. 5 out of the 8 accounts I mentioned above have been banned. nemruth, Atrain622 and lhfly5201314 haven't been banned and should be still able to make post in the forum. Since I happened to come across this thread, I checked it briefly.Also these three users are currently banned.

comments.author: hosemary
comments.body: Quote from: mole0815 on February 05, 2023, 03:26:37 PMSince I happened to come across this thread, I checked it briefly.Also these three users are currently banned. I thought they haven't been banned, because that's not recorded neither on modlog nor BPIP. nemruth and Atrain622 made post on February 2. Since modlog keeps the data for the past 7 days, their ban should be shown on modlog. It's weird that modlog doesn't show that.

comments.author: mole0815
comments.body: As I said, the 3 users mentioned here are currently banned.https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5438016.msg61710320#msg61710320Why this is not displayed on various pages or logs, I can not answer

comments.author: albon
comments.body: Quote from: JeromeTash on February 04, 2023, 01:22:53 PMAnybody who has a GitHub account can report this profile (https://github.com/BitcointalkWallet-project). It was created 2 days ago. I have reported it.Reported Done, dudeI hope the GitHub teams will review my report and ban the publisher's account as soon as possible.It is good that most of the accounts of these scammers have been banned from the forum, and I hope that members will not stop reporting their topics if they create new accounts.They created this wallet that contains Malware to target and hack the accounts of Bitcointalk members and their devices and steal their wallets, so in my experience, doing a system scan through an antivirus program for the device of someone who downloaded this wallet is useless. He must disconnect the Internet immediately, install a new Windows system, and download a program to freeze the system.
